metadata.title: CVE-2017-15897 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Node.js had a bug in versions 8.X and 9.X which caused buffers to not beinitialized when the encoding for the fill value did not match the encodingspecified. For example, 'Buffer.alloc(0x100, "This is not correctlyencoded", "hex");' The buffer implementation was updated such that thebuffer will be initialized to all zeros in these cases.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15897` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 8.10.0~dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.10.0~dfsg-2').
